intro: Discalyxia pullei, commonly known as the purple milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, purple-pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Discalyxia pullei is also known for its role in supporting local pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
